screens.headline: What if you could generate income whether you own a stock or not?
screens.text: The Wheel combines CSPs and covered calls into an endless income loop. It's the strategy that turns volatility into cash flow. In 8 minutes, you'll learn the system that pros use to print money month after month.

screens.headline: The Wheel = CSP ‚Üí Covered Call ‚Üí Repeat Forever
screens.text: Step 1: Sell CSP, collect premium. Step 2: If assigned, now you own 100 shares. Step 3: Sell covered call on those shares, collect premium. Step 4: If called away, back to Step 1. You generate income at EVERY step, whether you own the stock or not. It's an infinite loop.

screens.headline: Think of it like running a pawn shop
screens.text: Customer brings an item (CSP) ‚Üí You agree to buy it for $100 if they need cash. They pay you $5 to hold that promise. IF they need cash (stock drops), you buy the item for $100 (assigned). You clean it up and offer to sell it for $110 (covered call). Someone pays you $4 for the option to buy at $110. IF they buy it (stock called away), great - you made $10 + $5 + $4 = $19 profit. IF they don't buy it, you keep the $4 and offer to sell it again. Repeat forever.

screens.question: What's the MAIN advantage of the wheel over just covered calls or just CSPs?
options: Generate income whether you own the stock or not
You never lose money with the wheel
screens.explanation_correct: Exactly! The wheel lets you earn premium in ALL market conditions. Stock up? Covered calls. Stock down? CSPs. Don't own it yet? CSPs. Own it? Covered calls. You're always collecting income. That's the power!
screens.explanation_wrong: The wheel isn't about higher returns or no losses - it's about CONSISTENCY. You make income whether you own the stock (covered calls) or don't own it yet (CSPs). Always collecting premium.

screens.question: You're on Month 8 of wheeling. Stock is $320, your cost basis is $350. You're underwater $3,000. What do you do?
options: Stop the wheel - take the $3,000 loss
Keep selling covered calls at $360+ to recover
Switch to CSPs instead (you don't own it anymore)
Average down by buying more shares at $320
screens.explanation_correct: Perfect! You're underwater but still OWN the stock. Keep selling covered calls to collect premium and reduce your cost basis. Each $500 premium = -$5/share cost. After 6 more months of $500 calls, your cost is $320 = breakeven! Patience wins.
screens.explanation_wrong: Think about it: You OWN the stock at $350. Selling covered calls collects premium and reduces your cost basis. Don't panic sell - that's how you lock in losses. Keep wheeling!

screens.key_insight: The wheel thrives in FLAT and SLIGHTLY volatile markets. Not a bull market strategy!

cards.back: 1. Sell CSP (no stock). 2. Get assigned (buy stock). 3. Sell covered call (own stock). 4. Get called away (sell stock). Repeat 1-4 forever.
SIDEWAYS markets with volatility. Stock bounces in a range = you collect premium every month. Bull markets = wheel underperforms buy & hold.
Getting impatient when underwater. If assigned at $350 and stock drops to $320, DON'T panic sell. Keep selling covered calls to lower cost basis!
